metadata.Title: CVE-2013-1430 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in xrdp before 0.9.1. When successfully logging in using RDP into an xrdp session, the file ~/.vnc/sesman_${username}_passwd is created. Its content is the equivalent of the user's cleartext password, DES encrypted with a known key. It was discovered that xrdp used a known key to store session passwords in text files. An attacker could potentially decrypt the file to obtain a user password.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1430` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

xrdp - 0.6.0-1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xrdp package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.6.0-1ubuntu0.1').
